item.title: 10 Game Demos To Check Out At Steam Next Fest February 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • Steam Next Fest has indie and triple-A game demos. Many promising titles with positive feedback await.
  • Tempest Rising is a classic RTS with strategic economy management inspired by Command and Conquer.
  • Among Us 3D offers a fresh experience with proximity voice chat and first-person perspective gameplay.

Anyone trying to get a taste of the upcoming games in 2025 or later now has a golden opportunity to play a free demo of them as the first round of Steam Next Fest for this year is already live, with many indie developers - and some triple-A studios - showing off a vertical slice of their upcoming projects.

With the massive number of demos available and a limited time, it's difficult to choose which games to play, especially when there are so many promising titles with creative approaches. However, some demos have already received positive feedback from the fans, which sets up a bright future ahead of them.

10 Tempest Rising

A Classic RTS With Command And Conquer Vibes

If anyone misses the old RTS games like Red Alert , Generals , or StarCraft , then Tempest Rising is a must-wishlist for them, with a brief free demo already available to play. While featuring breathtaking visuals, Tempest Rising tries to remain as loyal as possible to classic games of the genre, where the army is the only thing that matters.

Just like its sources of inspiration, managing the economy is a key part of the game. Players start by building different manufacturing facilities to produce warfare machines or recruit infantry units and then lead the army towards the objectives. Both airborne and ground-based units are supported in the game, and battles are fought on a variety of unique maps.

Tempest Rising feels like a true spiritual successor to Command And Conquer: Generals , a game that never received its promised sequel.

9 Among Us 3D

Taking The Same Fun Experience To 3D With Voice Chat

While still not ready for a full release, Among Us 3D does have a free demo available at the moment to let the fans feel what the next evolution of the game will be like. The biggest feature to expect from the 3D version is the native proximity voice chat support that lets players talk together with no need for third-party programs.

The core gameplay still remains the same, but the first-person perspective does give the game a fresh feel and makes it a bit difficult for both impostors and crewmates, as their field of view is now limited, and they need to act more cautiously. It's worth noting that the current demo does not support VR yet.

8 RoadCraft

Use A Variety Of Construction Machines To Restore Roads

  • Developer: Saber Interactive
  • Release Date: May 20, 2025
  • Platforms: PS5, Xbox Series X|S, PC

Coming from the developers of SnowRunner , RoadCraft is a new experience in the same subgenre with a focus on restoring roads damaged by natural hazards using a wide variety of construction machines, each with its own unique feel and challenges.

Visually, RoadCraft seems more impressive than SnowRunner , but the gameplay loop might feel a bit slower, as players will have to use different machines with different purposes, though the missions feel more diverse, and they barely feel boring or repetitive.

7 Deliver At All Costs

A Chaotic Driving Experience Entangled With A Destructible Environment

  • Developer: Far Out Games
  • Release Date: To be announced
  • Platforms: PS5, Xbox Series X|S, PC

Deliver At All Costs is a light-hearted driving game that relies on its spectacularly destructible environment to inject more fun and chaos into the gameplay. The plan is simple. The player is tasked with delivering some peculiar cargo in each mission, and they must be delivered at all costs!

To cut the long roads short, players can drive through the buildings or jump over the rivers and overcome some natural hazards along the way. Throughout this chaotic journey, the game also has a story to tell, and the players will have to tackle some missions on foot while completing deliveries.

6 Deck Of Haunts

Become A True Mansion Evil And Scare The Hell Out Of The Residents

Hunderds of games have been released so far that put the player in the shoes of a lonely survivor trying to escape from a haunted mansion, but few games have done it vice versa. Deck of Haunts lets players enjoy being evil, scaring the residents of a haunted mansion by base-building and deck-building gameplay.

During the day, players expand their mansion by adding new rooms and corridors to it and giving more depth to the maze inside it, while at night, the rooms become the playground for the evil to play their cards of terror and drain the sanity of residents. That being said, evil is not immune to damage, as the player must secure the heart of terror, which is placed within the mansion.

5 Descenders Next

Snowboarding In Style With Some Dose Of Hardcore Gameplay

  • Developer: RageSquid
  • Release Date: April 9, 2025
  • Platforms: PS5, Xbox Series X|S, PS4, Xbox One, PC

After the incredible success of the original game simulating extreme cycling, now the same formula is back again with snowboarding. Descenders Next is less than two months away from its full release, and a free vertical slice of the game is more than appreciated by the community.

While the core gameplay remains almost unchanged, Descenders Next comes with skateboarding in dry environments and snowboarding on top of tall mountains, which adds a new variety to the game's environment. The roguelike elements and massive grind to master each track are all there for a fresh adventure.

4 Gothic 1 Remake

Discovering A Classic RPG With Modern Visuals

While still lacking a release date, a demo for Gothic 1 Remake seems like a good opportunity for the player base to provide more feedback before the full release. The goal of this demo is to acquaint the players with the overall atmosphere and feel of the game rather than showing all gameplay elements.

The demo includes a brief quest, during which players are introduced to the game's opening region, and they will have the freedom to explore the area and talk to the NPCs, though not much story progression will be made.

3 PUBG: Blindspot

A New, Creative Take On Competitive Shooters

  • Developer: ARC Team
  • Release Date: To be announced
  • Platforms: PC

The upcoming competitive shooter from the PUBG universe is quite a unique approach to the top-down shooter genre. Not that we never had tactical top-down shooters, but few of them have decided to make it a fully competitive experience.

PUBG: Blindspot feels like a top-down version of Rainbow Six: Siege . The game features unique heroes, each with their own abilities and equipment. Most maps feature complex interior design that requires teammates to clear it together and have a strategy for that.

The game has some unique and fun mechanics, like a shared visual among the squad, which lets one player see everything that their friends see in real time, and this rewards the team with best coordination.

2 Breathedge 2

A Loyal Sequel To The Beloved Space Survival

  • Developer: RedRuins Softworks
  • Release Date: To be announced
  • Platforms: PS5, PC

The original Breathedge is always remembered for its lovely humor, and it's a relief to see the sequel will keep that alive! Breathedge 2 remains loyal to its predecessor when it comes to the core gameplay while delivering a bigger world with new features like the spaceship, which is the real home to the protagonist and his crewmates.

Maintaining and upgrading the spaceship is a new gameplay loop, while driving other smaller vehicles - similar to the first game - is still available to explore the planet surface. The crafting system will allow players to create all sorts of useful and junky stuff, while new enemies are introduced to make it harder to survive!

1 Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone

Trying Out A New Direction With The Series

The first thing to note about Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone is that it has a completely different approach compared to its predecessor. It's not a continuation of Tatyana's story in the original game, and the story doesn't seem to be the main focus this time around.

Instead, Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone is more of a survival experience with a bigger focus on crafting, base building, and exploration. Not that it doesn't have a story to tell, but it is not supposed to be or feel like the original game's story.

The sequel also comes with a switchable perspective, letting players explore in first-person or third-person, though it seems like the latter is what the developers try to encourage the players to use. Such a massive change of direction does require a demo before release to let the fans test the waters before making a purchase.

item.title: Monopoly GO: How To Get More Hammer Tokens For Roll Treasures
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Free Hammers for Roll Treasures in Monopoly GO
  • Are There Any Free Pickaxe Links for Roll Treasures in Monopoly GO?

Get ready to do some digging as Sofia has returned in Monopoly GO with the launch of Roll Treasures. It’s scheduled to run for two days from Feb 24 to Feb 26.

The Roll Treasures event features many incredible rewards for participants. Players can win many different rewards like sticker packs and dice rolls. In the event, fans have to use their Hammer Tokens to break tiles and earn rewards. Fortunately, earning these tokens is very easy. Below, we’ll walk you through all of them.

How to Get Free Hammers for Roll Treasures in Monopoly GO

Below are some effective methods to earn Hammer tokens for the Roll Treasures minigame:

Events and Tournaments

Monopoly GO releases new events now and then to help players earn exciting rewards. These usually last two to three days. Right now, the Captain’s Quest event is available, which will be available for two days. It tasks fans with landing on the Utility and Tax tiles. Out of 62 event milestones, 14 offer these tokens. Let’s take a quick look at them:

Captain's Quest Milestones

Points Required

Rewards

1

Five

Three Hammer Tokens

6

30

Four Hammer Tokens

9

50

Four Hammer Tokens

13

65

Seven Hammer Tokens

16

70

Eight Hammer Tokens

21

100

10 Hammer Tokens

24

130

10 Hammer Tokens

27

150

15 Hammer Tokens

30

180

18 Hammer Tokens

36

250

20 Hammer Tokens

41

350

22 Hammer Tokens

45

450

25 Hammer Tokens

49

550

25 Hammer Tokens

53

750

28 Hammer Tokens

The Barrel Roll tournament is also live for one day, and it requires you to land on the Railroad spaces. In addition to banner events and tournaments, fans will also earn these tokens as they complete milestones in the Roll Treasures event.

Daily Tasks

The game has quick win goals that refresh every day. These are simple gameplay tasks that pay out a variety of materials like cash, stickers, and dice. When a minigame is live, these tasks also reward players with minigame tokens, including Hammer Tokens.

Free Gifts

Fans can get free gifts every eight hours from their in-game shop. These include items like dice, cash, and of course, Hammer tokens.

Are There Any Free Pickaxe Links for Roll Treasures in Monopoly GO?

Currently, there are no links available for Hammer tokens in Monopoly GO . If we get any links later, we will update this article.

item.title: Rumor: Call of Duty Warzone Bringing Back Iconic Modern Warfare Weapons in Season 3
item.description:
Summary

  • A new leak suggests the Grau 5.56 and HDR will be returning to Warzone in Season 3.
  • Recent rumors have also indicated that Verdansk will return to Warzone in March alongside the new season.
  • Activision has confirmed Verdansk will return to Warzone in Spring 2025, but has yet to set an official release date.

A trusted Call of Duty: Warzone leaker has revealed that developer Raven Software intends to bring back a handful of iconic Modern Warfare weapons for the game's big Season 3 update, including the Grau Assault Rifle and HDR Sniper Rifle. With Season 3 of Call of Duty: Warzone expected to launch sometime in March, leaks and rumors are beginning to ramp up as the update is also likely to see the return of Verdansk.

After the massive success of Fortnite OG, Call of Duty publisher Activision became the latest studio to follow in the newest gaming trend and confirmed that Verdansk would be returning to Warzone in Spring 2025. While the release window is fast approaching, the studio has yet to confirm an exact release date for the map's return, but recent leaks and rumors all point to a March launch alongside Season 3. With Warzone currently in a dire state, the entire Call of Duty community is eager to see if Verdansk's return will bring the Battle Royale title to its former glory. Some remain skeptical, but a new leak has just given players a glimmer of hope.

Warzone Rumor Suggests Modern Warfare Weapons Returning Soon

According to CharlieIntel, a trusted Call of Duty journalist, the Grau 5.56 and HDR may be returning to Warzone alongside Verdansk. In a new Twitter post, CharlieIntel said the weapons are "potentially returning." The iconic Assault Rifle and Sniper Rifle might not be the only Modern Warfare weapons returning in March. TheGhostOfHope also took to Twitter and said that the CR-56 AMAX and Kilo 141 will return with Season 3. However, the leaker does note that this is a "grain of salt rumor," meaning there's a chance these weapons don't actually make a return. Should they return, it's unclear whether or not they will also be available in Black Ops 6 Multiplayer, as both games usually share the same batch of weapons.

A separate post from CharlieIntel also claims that some content creators have been play-testing early builds of Verdansk in the current iteration of Warzone ​​​​​​, with different map elements and traversal features. The rumor also corroborates a recent leak from TheGhostOfHope, who revealed some key changes being made to Verdansk for its return to Warzone in March. Two sources have now stated that the map will be similar to the original version that launched in March 2020, with a handful of upgrades. While the original version of Verdansk had an inaccessible Stadium, leaks state that its interior will be open, but its roof will still remain closed.

The return of Verdansk is shaping up to be a monumental moment for Warzone , and Activision is supposedly well aware of its importance. According to CharlieIntel, the studio is trying to go "all out" for the map's return, which is apparently why Season 2 of Warzone had little to no content. While Black Ops 6 players were treated to a plethora of new maps, modes, and more, Warzone ​​​​​​fans were left with nothing more than a new perk. Activision says this was to prioritize gameplay tuning, bug fixes, and quality-of-life improvements, but it looks like it could have been to prepare for the return of Verdansk.

item.title: Tekken 8 Season 2 Brings Back Fan-Favorite Character
item.description:
Summary

  • Tekken 8 season 2 introduces Anna Williams as the first fighter, showcasing her deadly moves.
  • Anna will be making good use of her bazooka in melee and ranged attacks.
  • Fans are excited about the new content in season 2, praising Anna's design and reunion with her sister, Nina.

Bandai Namco is gearing up to deliver a boatload of new content in Tekken 8 ’s upcoming season 2, now that the game’s first year is over, and Anna Williams has been announced as the first fighter gracing the new season. Tekken 8 ’s Year 1 Pass included the arrival of new characters Angel Jin, Azucena Milagros Ortiz Castillo, and Victor Chevalier, alongside the surprising addition of protagonist Clive Rosfield from Final Fantasy 16 .

Tekken 8 was first released in 2024, and as the title suggests, it’s the eighth installment in the main Tekken series. The story mode is titled The Dark Awakens and is set six months after the events of Tekken 7 following the showdown between protagonist Jin Kazama and his father Kazuya Mishima. Tekken 8 was one of the top-selling 2024 games, alongside Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , EA Sports College Football 25 , and Helldivers 2 , and fans of the popular fighting franchise are confident season 2 will not disappoint.

Revealed in Bandai Namco’s three-minute gameplay trailer, Anna was welcomed to the line-up, showcasing the Scarlet Lightning’s combos and style in impressive combat footage. Viewers will also have seen that Anna will be making good use of her bazooka in melee and ranged attacks. The fighting game community has already devised a Tekken 8 season 2 DLC character wish list ahead of schedule, but the fandom is pleased about Anna’s return and players can get to know her on March 31, 2025, during the Early Access period, or on the official release of April 3, 2025.

Tekken 8 Season 2 Reveals Anna Williams as the First Fighter

Some fans believe the future Tekken 9 should atone for the sins of past entries, but Tekken 8 fans are happy to see the Williams sisters back together again and have a lot of praise to give to Anna's new design. The fandom was also quick to comment on Anna’s amazing dress sense, especially her jacket, and most agreed Bandai managed to avoid the “Karen look” by styling Anna’s haircut to perfection.

Anna first debuted in the very first Tekken game released in 1994 and was introduced as the sister to Nina Williams. Anna has returned for every entry, except Tekken 4 , and was welcomed as a new fighter in Tekken 7 , alongside Lei Wulong. The fighter is known for her skills as an assassin and martial artist, usually appearing in her signature red or blue silk dress, and took part in the first two King of Iron Fist Tournaments.

item.title: Fortnite: All SHADOW Briefings Job Board Locations (Chapter 6 Season 2)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All SHADOW Briefing Job Board Locations in Fortnite
  • All Armory Job Boards in Fortnite
  • All Supply Drop Job Boards in Fortnite
  • All Treasure Job Boards in Fortnite

The quest-giving objectives continue to spawn in Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 2, and these terminals can be found throughout the Battle Royale map to offer unique jobs and challenges to players that might reward them with valuable loot that could change the tide of a match and bring about a Victory Royale.

All SHADOW Briefing Job Boards in Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 2 can be found below, along with the quests and their rewards so that players don’t have to accept one of these jobs blind. With 3 specific SHADOW Briefing Job Boards on the map, let’s look at every location in Fortnite ’s current season.

All SHADOW Briefing Job Board Locations in Fortnite

As shown above, here are all SHADOW Briefing Job Boards found in Fortnite Battle Royale’s Chapter 6 Season 2: Lawless. There are over 20 SHADOW Briefing Job Boards that can be found within the map at specific locations, but it’s worth noting that only 70% of them will spawn – meaning sometimes players will not find a Job Board where one should be. If players want to try the SHADOW Briefing Job Boards for themselves, then the best route for this is to take a car, follow the road, and look at the mini-map for a symbol of a terminal when approaching the POI or Landmark.

More specific locations and every type of SHADOW Briefing Job Board challenge in Chapter 6 Season 2 can be found below.

All Armory Job Boards in Fortnite

There are 8 Armoy Job Boards in Chapter 6 Season 2, and here are the locations of each of them:

  • Within the Burd to Go minimart, North of Shiny Shafts
  • By the mining rig, South of Outlaw Oasis
  • On the East side of the bridge in Foxy Floodgate
  • Outside the tennis court in Masked Meadows
  • By the central building in Kappa Kappa Factory
  • In the East side of Seaport City
  • Found in the North area of Pumped Power
  • Inside Placid Paddies, between Whiffy Wharf and Flooded Frogs

Now that players know the location of every Armory Job Board in Chapter 6 Season 2, here is a look at all the total challenges that players can find at these Job Boards, along with their rewards:

Job

Time Limit

Reward

Grants an Uncommon Shotgun/SMG. Damage enemy players within 15 meters to earn bars! (0/100)

5 Minutes

100 Gold Bars

Grants an Uncommon Assault Rifle. Damage enemy players beyond 30 meters to earn bars! (0/75)

5 Minutes

100 Gold Bars

Grants an Uncommon Pistol/Assault Rifle. Damage enemy players while aiming down sights to earn bars! (0/150)

5 Minutes

100 Gold Bars

Grants an Uncommon Shotgun. Damage enemy players while hip-firing to earn bars! (0/100)

5 Minutes

100 Gold Bars

Grants an Uncommon Pistol/SMG. Headshot an enemy player to earn bars! (0/1)

5 Minutes

100 Gold Bars

Armory SHADOW Briefings work a tad differently, and players can accept one job from multiple, and then return to the same Job Board after completion to accept another one.

All Supply Drop Job Boards in Fortnite

There are 5 Supply Drop Job Boards in Chapter 6 Season 2, and for those seeking the easy rewards from this challenge, the locations of where to pick them up can be found below:

  • Yokina Boardwalk, West of Outlaw Oasis
  • North area of Hopeful Heights
  • North West building of Demon’s Dojo
  • North building of Brutal Boxcars
  • House found North of Moisty Manor, between Whiffy Wharf and Flooded Frogs

Those curious about the details of the Supply Drop Job Boards can find them below. It’s also worth mentioning that this Job Board is perhaps the easiest, although people will have to be cautious when locating and looting the random Supply Drop that spawns, as other players can indeed see it and might pursue its location for loot and kills.

Job

Time Limit

Rewards

Calls in a supply drop nearby. Search the Supply Drop to reap its rewards!

5 Minutes

Supply Drop Loot

All Plunder Job Boards in Fortnite

Players can find 8 Plunder Job Boards in Chapter 6 Season 2, and those brave enough to begin a treasure hunt can find the starting locations to accept these challenges below:

  • South area of Canyon Crossing
  • Center of Spiral Shoots, South of Masked Meadows
  • East area of Shogun’s Solitude
  • South area of Shiny Shafts
  • East building of Lovely Lane, found South of Whiffy Wharf
  • North building of Magic Mosses
  • Yacht Stop, North of Magic Mosses
  • Outside the minimart in Burd to Go, North of Shining Span

The Treasure Job Boards provide players with a challenge to amass decent loot from a secret Rare Chest, as it will mark the location of buried treasure that can be dug out with a Pickaxe:

Job

Time Limit

Rewards

Spawns two buried Rare chests nearby. Find and dig them up to reap their rewards!

5 Minutes

2 Rare Chests Loot

Map images courtesy of Fortnite.gg
